Line 13: Line 13:
By 2009, a formal leadership board had been established<ref>http://www.google.co.nz/url?sa=t&source=web&cd=5&ved=0CDcQqQIwBA&url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.stuff.co.nz%2Fbusiness%2Fsmall-business%2F4499510%2FKlickEx-exchanging-currencies-without-fees&ei=IUsdTdH3NYu6sAPYv4XIAg&usg=AFQjCNEqkHalEHwJblMvMhn-xaYY5Qu9og&sig2=WjYS9gbcGwjMyaqSRf9vFg</ref>, including [[Xero]] Chairman Phil Norman, former Microsoft NZ Managing Director Ross Peat and former "IceHouse" Director Terry Allen; the trading identity "KlickEx" was officially incorporated.
By 2009, a formal leadership board had been established<ref>http://www.google.co.nz/url?sa=t&source=web&cd=5&ved=0CDcQqQIwBA&url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.stuff.co.nz%2Fbusiness%2Fsmall-business%2F4499510%2FKlickEx-exchanging-currencies-without-fees&ei=IUsdTdH3NYu6sAPYv4XIAg&usg=AFQjCNEqkHalEHwJblMvMhn-xaYY5Qu9og&sig2=WjYS9gbcGwjMyaqSRf9vFg</ref>, including [[Xero]] Chairman Phil Norman, former Microsoft NZ Managing Director Ross Peat and former "IceHouse" Director Terry Allen; the trading identity "KlickEx" was officially incorporated.
â
In 2010, two further countries were added (Samoa & Tonga) and closed network testing completed. In September 2010, the pilot launch was concluded, with over 10,000 transactions occurring. The company was officially launched on the 16th December<ref>http://www.scoop.co.nz/stories/BU1012/S00571/klickex-launches-a-cheaper-way-to-exchange-currencies.htm</ref>, and has continued to increase customers at a compounded rate of 35%/week{{Citation needed|date=January 2011}}.
+
In 2010, two further countries were added (Samoa & Tonga) and closed network testing completed. In September 2010, the pilot launch was concluded, with over 10,000 transactions occurring. The company was officially launched on the 16th December<ref>http://www.scoop.co.nz/stories/BU1012/S00571/klickex-launches-a-cheaper-way-to-exchange-currencies.htm</ref>, and has continued to increase customers at a compounded rate of 35%/week.{{Citation needed|date=January 2011}}.
In early 2011, [[KlickEx]] was officially designated as an independently regulated Financial Institution - enabling KlickEx to undertake settlements across a broader range of service levels (including processing transactions outside banking hours, and/or over regional public holidays where domestic banks were closed).
In early 2011, [[KlickEx]] was officially designated as an independently regulated Financial Institution - enabling KlickEx to undertake settlements across a broader range of service levels (including processing transactions outside banking hours, and/or over regional public holidays where domestic banks were closed).
